intro: Phlomis samia var. bicolor, commonly known as the Two-color Phlomis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its striking, two-toned flowers that range from purple to white, often with a contrasting central stripe. The plant features upright, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often grayish-green in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its bloom period typically occurs in late summer, adding a vibrant splash of color to the garden.
